content:
TypeProvider Class

In this Article

An implementation of ITypeProvider that acts as a container of types within the indicated assemblies and code compile units.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public sealed class TypeProvider : IDisposable, IServiceProvider, System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ITypeProvider

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • TypeProvider

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

This ITypeProvider implementation, in addition to handling compiled assemblies (AddAssembly and AddAssemblyReference methods), can handle types that have not been compiled yet (AddCodeCompileUnit). The limited implementation of System.Type is returned for types referenced using CodeCompileUnit.

Note

TypeProvider only returns public types from referenced assemblies, and both public and non-public types from local assemblies.

Constructors summary

TypeProvider(IServiceProvider)

Initializes a new instance of the TypeProvider class.

Properties summary

AssemblyNameResolver

Gets or sets the delegate that references a method with one parameter and one return value that returns the assembly display name in which a specified type belongs to.
IsSupportedPropertyResolver

Gets or sets the delegate that references a method with two parameters and one return value that determines whether a specified property is supported in the target .NET Framework.
LocalAssembly

Gets a value that represents the locally defined Assembly for this instance.
ReferencedAssemblies

Gets a collection of all assemblies referenced by the Type.
TypeLoadErrors

Gets an IDictionary of load error exceptions keyed by the Object that causes the Exception.

Methods summary

AddAssembly(Assembly)

Adds an already-loaded assembly. It is the caller's responsibility to load the assembly, and TypeProvider includes the types from this assembly for dispensing when stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.GetType* is called.
AddAssemblyReference(String)

Adds a reference to the stem.Type.Assembly* to the internal list. This assembly is used for the Type lookup in the stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.GetType* method.
AddCodeCompileUnit(CodeCompileUnit)

Adds a reference to the CodeCompileUnit to the internal list. This CodeCompileUnit is used for the Type lookup in the stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.GetType* method.
Dispose()

Releases all resources used by the TypeProvider.
GetAssemblyName(Type)

Returns the assembly display name of the assembly in which the specified type is declared.
GetEnumNames(Type)

Provides a string array that contains the names for the specified Enum in indexed order.
GetEventHandlerType(EventInfo)

Gets the Type of an EventHandler, given a reference to an EventInfo.
GetService(Type)

Gets the Object that provides the designated service Type.
GetType(String)

Gets the type from the set of assemblies added to the TypeProvider using stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddAssembly*, stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddAssemblyReference*, or stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddCodeCompileUnit*.
GetType(String,Boolean)

Gets the type from the set of assemblies added to the TypeProvider using stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddAssembly*, stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddAssemblyReference*, or stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddCodeCompileUnit*.
GetTypes()

Creates an array that contains each Type known to this instance.
IsAssignable(Type,Type)

Indicates whether one type can be safely assigned to another type.
IsEnum(Type)

Indicates whether a Type is of type Enum .
IsSubclassOf(Type,Type)

Indicates whether a Type is a derived class of another Type .
IsSupportedProperty(PropertyInfo,Object)

Returns a value that determines whether the specified property is supported in the target .NET Framework.
RefreshCodeCompileUnit(CodeCompileUnit,EventHandler)

Updates the CodeCompileUnit reference associated with this instance.
RemoveAssembly(Assembly)

Removes all references to the subject Assembly from this instance.
RemoveAssemblyReference(String)

Removes a path-based Assembly reference from this instance.
RemoveCodeCompileUnit(CodeCompileUnit)

Removes all references to the subject CodeCompileUnit from this instance.
SetLocalAssembly(Assembly)

Sets the value of the local Assembly to the referenced Assembly .

Events summary

TypeLoadErrorsChanged

Occurs when the collection stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.TypeLoadErrors* is modified.
TypesChanged

Occurs when the collection of defined types is modified.

Constructors

  • TypeProvider(IServiceProvider)

    Initializes a new instance of the TypeProvider class.

    public TypeProvider (IServiceProvider serviceProvider);

    Parameters

    • serviceProvider
      IServiceProvider

      The encapsulated IServiceProvider for this instance.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to create a new instance of the TypeProvider class. This code example is part of the BasicDesignerHosting SDK Sample from the WorkflowLoader.cs file. For more information, seeBasic Designer Hosting. 

    TypeProvider typeProvider = new TypeProvider(host);
typeProvider.AddAssemblyReference(typeof(string).Assembly.Location);

    Dim typeProvider As TypeProvider = New TypeProvider(host)
typeProvider.AddAssemblyReference(GetType(String).Assembly.Location)

Properties

  • AssemblyNameResolver

    Gets or sets the delegate that references a method with one parameter and one return value that returns the assembly display name in which a specified type belongs to.

    public Func<Type,string> AssemblyNameResolver { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Func<Type,String>

      The delegate that references a method with one parameter and one return value that returns the assembly display name that a specified type belongs to.

  • IsSupportedPropertyResolver

    Gets or sets the delegate that references a method with two parameters and one return value that determines whether a specified property is supported in the target .NET Framework.

    public Func<System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,object,bool> IsSupportedPropertyResolver { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Func<PropertyInfo,Object,Boolean>

      The delegate that references a method with two parameters and one return value that determines whether a specified property is supported in the target .NET Framework.

  • LocalAssembly

    Gets a value that represents the locally defined Assembly for this instance.

    public System.Reflection.Assembly LocalAssembly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Assembly

      The locally defined Assembly for this instance.

  • ReferencedAssemblies

    Gets a collection of all assemblies referenced by the Type.

    public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Reflection.Assembly> ReferencedAssemblies { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection<Assembly>

      A collection of all assemblies referenced by the Type.

  • TypeLoadErrors

    Gets an IDictionary of load error exceptions keyed by the Object that causes the Exception.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<object,Exception> TypeLoadErrors { get; }

    Property Value

    • IDictionary<Object,Exception>

      An IDictionary of load error exceptions keyed by the Object that causes the Exception.

    Remarks

    An updated, detached IDictionary is created at each reference to this property.

Methods

  • AddAssembly(Assembly)

    Adds an already-loaded assembly. It is the caller's responsibility to load the assembly, and TypeProvider includes the types from this assembly for dispensing when stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.GetType* is called.

    public void AddAssembly (System.Reflection.Assembly assembly);

    Parameters

    • assembly
      Assembly

      The stem.Type.Assembly* to add a reference for.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      assembly is a null reference (Visual Basic Nothing).

  • AddAssemblyReference(String)

    Adds a reference to the stem.Type.Assembly* to the internal list. This assembly is used for the Type lookup in the stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.GetType* method.

    public void AddAssemblyReference (string path);

    Parameters

    • path
      String

      The path of the stem.Type.Assembly* to add.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      path is a null reference (Visual Basic Nothing).

    Example

    The following code example shows how to create a new instance of the TypeProvider class and run the AddAssemblyReference method. This code example is part of the BasicDesignerHosting SDK Sample from the WorkflowLoader.cs file. For more information, seeBasic Designer Hosting. 

    TypeProvider typeProvider = new TypeProvider(host);
typeProvider.AddAssemblyReference(typeof(string).Assembly.Location);

    Dim typeProvider As TypeProvider = New TypeProvider(host)
typeProvider.AddAssemblyReference(GetType(String).Assembly.Location)
  • AddCodeCompileUnit(CodeCompileUnit)

    Adds a reference to the CodeCompileUnit to the internal list. This CodeCompileUnit is used for the Type lookup in the stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.GetType* method.

    public void AddCodeCompileUnit (System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit codeCompileUnit);

    Parameters

    • codeCompileUnit
      CodeCompileUnit

      The CodeCompileUnit to add.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      codeCompileUnit is a null reference (Visual Basic Nothing).

    • ArgumentException

      codeCompileUnit is already referenced in this instance.

  • Dispose()

    Releases all resources used by the TypeProvider.

    public void Dispose ();
  • GetAssemblyName(Type)

    Returns the assembly display name of the assembly in which the specified type is declared.

    public string GetAssemblyName (Type type);

    Parameters

    • type
      Type

      The type whose assembly name to get.

    Returns

    • String

      The assembly display name of the assembly in which the specified type is declared.

  • GetEnumNames(Type)

    Provides a string array that contains the names for the specified Enum in indexed order.

    public static string[] GetEnumNames (Type enumType);

    Parameters

    • enumType
      Type

      The type to obtain the names from.

    Returns

    • String[]

      The names for the specified Enum in indexed order.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      enumType is a null reference (Visual Basic Nothing).

    • ArgumentException

      enumType Is not an Enum.

  • GetEventHandlerType(EventInfo)

    Gets the Type of an EventHandler, given a reference to an EventInfo.

    public static Type GetEventHandlerType (System.Reflection.EventInfo eventInfo);

    Parameters

    • eventInfo
      EventInfo

      The EventInfo to obtain the EventHandler type of.

    Returns

    • Type

      The Type of an EventHandler, given a reference to an EventInfo.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      eventInfo is a null reference (Visual Basic Nothing).

  • GetService(Type)

    Gets the Object that provides the designated service Type.

    public object GetService (Type serviceType);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The service Type that the Object is to provide.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The Object that provides the designated service Type.

    Remarks

    If the encapsulated IServiceProvider associated with this instance is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) then a null reference (Nothing) is returned.

  • GetType(String)

    Gets the type from the set of assemblies added to the TypeProvider using stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddAssembly*, stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddAssemblyReference*, or stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddCodeCompileUnit*.

    public Type GetType (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The type name.

    Returns

    • Type

      The requested Type.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      name is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)

    Remarks

    If the name is not resolvable within the cache of assemblies and compiled units of this instance, a null reference (Visual Basic Nothing) is returned. Invoking this overload is the same as invoking the two parameter overloads with the value of the parameter throwOnError set to true.

  • GetType(String,Boolean)

    Gets the type from the set of assemblies added to the TypeProvider using stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddAssembly*, stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddAssemblyReference*, or stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.AddCodeCompileUnit*.

    public Type GetType (string name, bool throwOnError);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The type name.

    • throwOnError
      Boolean

      A value that indicates whether to throw an exception if name is not resolvable.

    Returns

    • Type

      The requested Type.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      name is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)

    • Exception

      name is not resolvable and throwOnError is true.

    Remarks

    If the name is not resolvable within the cache of assemblies and compiled units of this instance, a null reference (Nothing) is returned; in the case that throwOnError is false.

  • GetTypes()

    Creates an array that contains each Type known to this instance.

    public Type[] GetTypes ();

    Returns

    • Type[]

      An array that contains each Type known to this instance.

    Exceptions

    • ReflectionTypeLoadException

      Any Type fails to load.

  • IsAssignable(Type,Type)

    Indicates whether one type can be safely assigned to another type.

    public static bool IsAssignable (Type toType, Type fromType);

    Parameters

    • toType
      Type

      The target Type of the assignment.

    • fromType
      Type

      The source Type of the assignment.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the assignment can be safely made; otherwise false.

  • IsEnum(Type)

    Indicates whether a Type is of type Enum .

    public static bool IsEnum (Type type);

    Parameters

    • type
      Type

      The Type to be tested.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the Type is an Enum ; otherwise false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      type is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • IsSubclassOf(Type,Type)

    Indicates whether a Type is a derived class of another Type .

    public static bool IsSubclassOf (Type subclass, Type superClass);

    Parameters

    • subclass
      Type

      The Type being tested as a derived class.

    • superClass
      Type

      The Type being tested as the class.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the tested relationship is true; otherwise false.

  • IsSupportedProperty(PropertyInfo,Object)

    Returns a value that determines whether the specified property is supported in the target .NET Framework.

    public bool IsSupportedProperty (System.Reflection.PropertyInfo property, object declaringInstance);

    Parameters

    • property
      PropertyInfo

      The property to resolve.

    • declaringInstance
      System.Object

      The instance in which the specified property is declared.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified property is supported in the target .NET Framework; otherwise, false.

  • RefreshCodeCompileUnit(CodeCompileUnit,EventHandler)

    Updates the CodeCompileUnit reference associated with this instance.

    public void RefreshCodeCompileUnit (System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit codeCompileUnit, EventHandler refresher);

    Parameters

    • codeCompileUnit
      CodeCompileUnit

      The CodeCompileUnit to refresh with.

    • refresher
      EventHandler

      The EventHandler to delegate this event to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      codeCompileUnit is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentException

      This instance already references the subject CodeCompileUnit.

    Remarks

    The TypesChanged is raised when this method is invoked.

  • RemoveAssembly(Assembly)

    Removes all references to the subject Assembly from this instance.

    public void RemoveAssembly (System.Reflection.Assembly assembly);

    Parameters

    • assembly
      Assembly

      The Assembly to remove from this instance.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      assembly is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)

    Remarks

    The TypesChanged is raised when this method is invoked.

  • RemoveAssemblyReference(String)

    Removes a path-based Assembly reference from this instance.

    public void RemoveAssemblyReference (string path);

    Parameters

    • path
      String

      The path of the Assembly to be removed.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      path is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)

    Remarks

    The TypesChanged is raised when this method is invoked.

  • RemoveCodeCompileUnit(CodeCompileUnit)

    Removes all references to the subject CodeCompileUnit from this instance.

    public void RemoveCodeCompileUnit (System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit codeCompileUnit);

    Parameters

    • codeCompileUnit
      CodeCompileUnit

      The CodeCompileUnit to be removed.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      codeCompileUnit is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)

    Remarks

    The TypesChanged is raised when this method is invoked.

  • SetLocalAssembly(Assembly)

    Sets the value of the local Assembly to the referenced Assembly .

    public void SetLocalAssembly (System.Reflection.Assembly assembly);

    Parameters

    • assembly
      Assembly

      The Assembly used to set this value

    Remarks

    The TypesChanged is raised when this method is invoked. Call SetLocalAssembly before you call AddAssembly(Assembly) otherwise it has no affect on the TypeProvider.

Events

  • TypeLoadErrorsChanged

    Occurs when the collection stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider.TypeLoadErrors* is modified.

    public event EventHandler TypeLoadErrorsChanged;
  • TypesChanged

    Occurs when the collection of defined types is modified.

    public event EventHandler TypesChanged;
